com.intel.fightclub.encryption.common.util

Class SecurityUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.fightclub.encryption.common.util.SecurityUtil

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class SecurityUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    General helper methods and constants used for both encryption and decryption.

    • Field Detail

      • AES_BLOCK_SIZE_BYTES

        public static final int AES_BLOCK_SIZE_BYTES
        Convenience variable for the default AES block size in bytes. It is always 16 bytes (128 bits) regardless of the key size that is used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AES_KEYGEN_ALGORITHM

        @NonNls
 @NotNull
public static final java.lang.String AES_KEYGEN_ALGORITHM
        The AES key generation algorithm to use.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AES_TRANSFORMATION

        @NonNls
 @NotNull
public static final java.lang.String AES_TRANSFORMATION
        The AES encryption mode to use. We use the AES encryption algorithm in cipher block chaining mode with PKCS#7 padding.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OAEP_HASH_FUNCTION

        @NonNls
 @NotNull
public static final java.lang.String OAEP_HASH_FUNCTION
        Hash function to use with OAEP padding.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OAEP_MASK_FUNCTION

        @NonNls
 @NotNull
public static final java.lang.String OAEP_MASK_FUNCTION
        Mask function to use with OAEP padding.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RSA_KEYGEN_ALGORITHM

        @NonNls
 @NotNull
public static final java.lang.String RSA_KEYGEN_ALGORITHM
        The RSA key generation algorithm to use.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RSA_TRANSFORMATION

        @NonNls
 @NotNull
public static final java.lang.String RSA_TRANSFORMATION
        The RSA encryption mode to use. We use the RSA encryption algorithm with OAEP padding. This does not use ECB in any shape or form. This is an artifact of the Sun security provider and is meaningless.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TOP_HEADER

        @NonNls
 @NotNull
public static final java.lang.String TOP_HEADER
        Top header (8 bytes) that is found at the beginning of every encrypted file. If this is not found, then the file should be discarded.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
